title: Prologue
dialog: Rumors of the Tsuruga Grand Shrine traveled far and wide across the land.

Word goes that a God laid down the foundations for the trial grounds there, and whoever had the skills (or luck) to pass the trials will be rewarded with precious artifacts, crafted by the Gods themselves.
Every minute of careful planning leads up to this moment! Tsuruga Grand Shrine, be prepared for the greatness that is me!
A Shrine Maiden paused sweeping and glared at me.

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: Ugh, outsiders who have no respect for the trials nor for the Shrine, undermining the danger with eyes only on the ultimate prize. Do you mind moving a bit? I'm trying to sweep here.
Oops, moving now. Though I have to assure you, I am confident that my team and I will pass the fabled trials!

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: I've heard this spoken countless times. Few actually followed through. Anyways, I should be getting back to my duties, so good luck out there.
Aww, that's so nice of you, Miss. If you are also in the mood to impart wisdom on how to clear the trials, I'd be all ears.

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: The only advice I will be giving you today is to go home. You'd at least leave with all your limbs intact.
Nope, that's not an option. So, since helpful words are out of the picture, maybe some helpful charms and talismans...?

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: Even if there was one, it's bold of you to assume that I'd be handing them out freely. Since you have already made up your mind, then there's nothing I can say or do to help. As I said before, good luck.

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: ...If Chizuko was here, she would have tried her best to convince you to leave. But she doesn't understand that bullheaded folks like you just won't change your minds like that...
Thank you! By the way, who's this Chizuko person you're talking about...?

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: Don't even think about it. Chizuko is kind, adorable, and way out of your league.
She sounds nice and friendly! I will definitely try to befriend her after I pass the trials.

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: Ugh, you're hopeless. Now scram and stop getting in the way.
See you later! ...Treasure, treasure, here I come~

title: New Friends?
dialog: I'm tired. Exhausted. This patch of ground is nice and comfortable, and I don't want to move.

name: Uriel
dialog: Well done, Senpai! We have gathered a bunch of Origami Cranes. This should be enough for a reward from the Pond of Prayers.
Ooh, a reward! I suddenly feel much more motivated to get up now. Goodbye, comfortable patch of earth.
A very familiar Shrine Maiden swept her broom over my feet. Rude.

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: Ugh, you again...is this the "team" you mentioned last time?

name: Uriel
dialog: Good day, Miss. My name is Uriel.
I'm so glad to see you again! As you may have guessed, I passed the trials! With all my limbs intact, no less!
Look, I even got the Origami Cranes to prove it!

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: Hmph, those are authentic "Symbols of Approval". I'm surprised that you actually passed the trials. Or did this lady do all the work for you?

name: Uriel
dialog: Oh no, I can't take all the credit. Senpai pulled his weight in the trial.
Hear, hear!

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: Good.\nWhy are you standing in the way? The Pond of Prayers is that way.
My bad, my bad.
I'm *, by the way. Do you mind telling me your name? I can't always call you "Miss", and we're probably going to see each other again.

name: Mami
dialog: ...It's Mami.

name: Mami
dialog: ...Do you need anything else?

name: KongMing
dialog: Senpai, Uriel.

name: KongMing
dialog: Instead of clearing the trials and collecting treasure for the Academy like the others, I have a different mission for you. Multiple missions, to be exact.

name: Ithil
dialog: *, aside from passing the trials, you will be infiltrating the Shrine, befriending the Shrine Maidens and Priestesses.

name: Ithil
dialog: When you have done so, you will try your best to uncover the secrets of the Shrine, especially the source of the treasures.

name: KongMing
dialog: The treasures are effective when fighting against Chaos, and any information about them would benefit us greatly.

name: KongMing
dialog: Uriel, you are in charge of Senpai's safety. Shady characters have been reported to visit the Shrine, and asking around may draw unwanted attention to Senpai.

name: Uriel
dialog: I swear on my Shield and my honor as a Knight that I will not allow any harm to befall Senpai.
Knowledge, maybe? I'd like to learn more about your Shrine.
The God that this Shrine is dedicated to, the origins of the trials, the history of the treasures, that sort of thing. Since you work here, you must know a lot about this Shrine, right? Please?

name: Mami
dialog: Huh, that's new.

name: Mami
dialog: Most just take the treasure and leave. Not many people want to learn about our Shrine.
Yes, that's me, always eager to learn! So please? Pretty please? With cherries and ice cream and marshmallows on top?

name: Mami
dialog: I'm starting to think you are looking for diabetes instead of knowledge.
Aww, you shouldn't insult my eating habits before you try it yourself. I know this really good cake place...

name: Mami
dialog: Thanks, but no thanks.

name: Mami
dialog: I'm not an expert in story-telling, so you're barking up the wrong tree if it truly is knowledge that you're seeking.

name: Mami
dialog: Visit the Shrine Office at nightfall: Ms. Mizue will be recounting the history of the Shrine, as well as past legends to the younger Shrine Maidens. They wouldn't mind anyone joining them.

name: Mami
dialog: However, don't even think about disturbing them, or I will hunt you down personally and murder you with this broom. Are we clear?
Aww, you wound me with your suspicions.

name: Mami
dialog: It's always beneficial to be cautious. Who knows what shady businesses you outsiders are up to?

name: Mami
dialog: Now, if you will excuse me, I need to get back to sweeping.
...(Puppy eyes)

name: Mami
dialog: ...What.
You mentioned a girl named Chizuko last time, right?
Do you think I can meet her? I mean, a friend of yours is a friend of mine! Right?

name: Mami
dialog: Get. Out.

title: Story Night
name: Uriel
dialog: Senpai, what happened? You were so hyper before, and now you're just…wallowing in misery.
Nothing big, just a bit miffed that Mami doesn't seem to trust me. Especially after everything we've been through together!

name: Uriel
dialog: ...You've had a grand total of two conversations with her, Senpai. I think you should give her more time.
You're right, she must be taken aback by my overflowing friendliness. She probably needs more time to get used to me. Hey, is that the Shrine Office up ahead?
Not too far away young Shrine Maidens can be seen sitting on stools and listening attentively to an elderly Priestess.

name: Uriel
dialog: Looks like we're just in time. Unfortunately, all seats are taken, so we must stand for the entirety of the session.
(Pushes two spare stools forward)
Thank you, dearie.

name: Uriel
dialog: She seems like a shy kid.
Well, yet another mystery to the mix. Let's just listen to what Ms. Mizue has to say first so we can bring some information back to KongMing and Ithil.

name: Mizue
dialog: Now, can anyone tell me what did we cover last time?
(Raises hand) You said that the land upon which our Shrine is built used to be wide, fertile plains, and that crops grew without being cultivated!

name: Mizue
dialog: Excellent! Well done, Chizuko.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Hurray!
(Ah, this must be the Chizuko girl Mami mentioned. She is as adorable as I imagined.)

name: Mizue
dialog: Before the Tsuruga Grand Shrine was established, this region was called Sawagi, meaning "moist and plentiful lands".

name: Mizue
dialog: Sawagi, as Chizuko mentioned, was a wide and fertile terrain. Trees bore fruit overnight, and its habitants never worried about starving.

name: Mizue
dialog: Everything changed when two monsters arrived.

name: Mizue
dialog: They were brothers: the older brother was named Ao Oni, while the younger brother called itself Aka Oni. Ao Oni drew in rain clouds and flooded rivers and lakes when it cried; Aka Oni brought about droughts when it laughed.

name: Mizue
dialog: They came from the Tsuyuoka region, where they caused mischief.

name: Mizue
dialog: The people of Tsuyuoka had the ability to communicate with Gods. When the brothers were too much to bear with, they plead to the Gods to stop the brothers.

name: Mizue
dialog: The Gods heard the prayers. They descended to the mortal world and beheaded the brothers. However, they were no ordinary monsters and could survive even with their heads separated from their bodies.

name: Mizue
dialog: The brothers fled Tsuyuoka with their heads when the Gods were taken unawares.

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni and Aka Oni traveled across the world, suffering from hunger and the cold in search of another place to settle down. When they reached Sawagi, they were bitter about what they have experienced and were jealous of the Sawagi people who lived happy and carefree lives.

name: Mizue
dialog: They robbed the people, moving into the most luxurious house in the region, and will only be appeased with annual offerings of treasure, food, and a young girl. Unlike the people of Tsuyuoka, the people of Sawagi couldn't communicate with the Gods, and any efforts to rebel against their oppression were met with a swift and bloody end. They had no choice but to comply with the brothers' requests.

name: Mizue
dialog: The two monsters thrived with the yearly offerings. The sacrifice was killed in cold blood, and huge bonfires were raised to burn the body.

name: Mizue
dialog: Much to Aka Oni's displeasure, the people of Sawagi didn't fall into poverty as it expected, thanks to the fertile soil of the region.

name: Mizue
dialog: It wanted them to suffer as itself and its brother did on the travels, so it started to laugh every day, bringing droughts to the land.

name: Mizue
dialog: The soil gradually became barren as Aka Oni's laughs boomed across the land on a daily basis, and crops stopped growing despite the best efforts of the Sawagi people.

name: Mizue
dialog: The yearly demands of food became impossible to fulfill, but Aka Oni showed no mercy. It tortured the people when it didn't get what it wanted.

name: Mizue
dialog: Aka Oni finally achieved its dreams of seeing the inhabitants of Sawagi suffer as it did.

name: Mizue
dialog: When all seemed bleak, Enbi no Mikoto, a brave young woman and our savior, decided to stand against Aka Oni and end its "rule".

name: Mizue
dialog: She wanted Sawagi to return to what it was before the brothers arrived and reasoned that the only way to achieve this was to slay Aka Oni, who brought about all the droughts.

name: Mizue
dialog: ...And that's all for today. You will learn more about Enbi no Mikoto and what she did tomorrow.

name: Uriel
dialog: I wonder whether Enbi no Mikoto succeeded in killing the monster. Since she is called "the Savior", then she probably did.
It's likely. Or maybe she failed, but her sacrifice urged the Sawagi people to rebel against the brothers, like a symbol.

name: Uriel
dialog: I hope not. It's not a befitting ending for someone like her.

name: Uriel
dialog: The sun should shine bright in the sky, not dragged down to the depths of the underworld.
Who knows? It's all speculation at this point.
We should come back tomorrow; I'd like to learn something about the Pond of Prayers, and you can find out what happened to Enbi no Mikoto.

title: Crossing Paths
name: Chizuko
dialog: (Hums a merry tune)

name: Uriel
dialog: She looks familiar.
Wait, I think I know who she is...you're Chizuko, right?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Oh, yes! But why do you know my name?
I'm *, and this is Uriel. We were there yesterday at Ms. Mizue's lecture.
And I've chatted with Mami, who says that you're kind and adorable.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Oooh, really?

name: Chizuko
dialog: I don't know I should be mortified that she talks about me to total strangers, or be delighted that she does.
I'd go with delighted. I mean, she surely thinks highly of you.
I can't say the same for myself though, seeing how she always looks irritated when I'm around.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Yes, that sounds like Mami. She's very protective of us, you see. There was an incident where an outsider tried to kidnap a Shrine Maiden for the secrets of our Shrine.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Thankfully, Mami chased him out before he succeeded, or we would be in great trouble. She's been wary of outsiders ever since.

name: Chizuko
dialog: At least she hasn't chased you out with her broom yet. I think that means you're okay in her books.
(But she treats me like dirt...literally. With her sweeping broom.)

name: Chizuko
dialog: I'm still a Shrine-Maiden-in-training for now, but I want to be like Mami in the future.

name: Chizuko
dialog: She is warm, caring, skillful, and just the best big sister anyone can ask for!

name: Uriel
dialog: Speaking of this, I'm wondering why the Shrine allowed the rumors to spread.

name: Uriel
dialog: Wouldn't it be a lot safer for you without having to deal with the Outsiders coming and going every day for the treasure?

name: Chizuko
dialog: I don't think we can stop the rumors even if we wanted to; everyone must have heard of them by now!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Besides, our Senior Priestess said that it is vital to have outsiders participating in the trials instead of just us Shrine Maidens.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Seeing how the trials are...you know what, you should join us again tonight. I'm sure Ms. Mizue will cover this in her narration.
Not even a spoiler?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Nope! You don't see people who are actually interested in the Shrine every day. Most are just here for the trial and the treasure.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Us Shrine Maidens are responsible for passing down knowledge and traditions, so that's what I'm doing!

name: Uriel
dialog: Of course. We still haven't found out whether Enbi no Mikoto managed to defeat the Aka Oni or not.

name: Chizuko
dialog: As I said, no spoilers!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Enbi no Mikoto is one of the people that I admire a lot, and I like her legend a lot. I can't ruin the experience of hearing her tale for you.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Oops, duty calls. See you later~
Judging from her tone, I think Enbi no Mikoto succeeded, or else she wouldn't be so enthusiastic.

name: Uriel
dialog: I sure hope so.
It's time for us to head back to the trials anyway; we need to gather more Origami Cranes to exchange treasure with.
Or should I say "Symbols of Approval"? That's what Mami called them, right?
Too much time has passed since I've left. What do they call this place now...Sawagi? No, no, it's Tsuruga, the name of the Shrine.
Too many demons lurk in the shadows, too much pain and despair threaten to consume me wherever I went, so I fled...
But now everything has changed, and the Tsuruga Grand Shrine is only a shadow of its former glory.
If we haven't hesitated that night and sought refuge in the Shrine…we would have changed our fates, wouldn't we?

name: Izanami
dialog: I wouldn't have been infected by Chaos, and you would never have left me behind…

name: Izanami
dialog: Where are you now, Izanagi?

name: Izanami
dialog: Have you ever returned to this land that we once called home?

name: Uriel
dialog: Senpai?
I think I saw someone familiar...but she was gone when I blinked.

name: Uriel
dialog: Perhaps another student from the Academy? We're not the only ones KongMing and Ithil sent.
I'm not sure...maybe I'm just imagining things. Anyways, we have a trial to clear. Let's do that.

title: Story Night…Again
name: Uriel
dialog: Senpai, Senpai, over here! Ms. Mizue is just about to start!
Coming! You are really invested in this story now, Uriel.

name: Uriel
dialog: I'm afraid I won't be able to sleep soundly without knowing the end of this tale.

name: Uriel
dialog: I wonder if Chizuko made it... I can't find her with everyone wearing the same Shrine Maiden uniforms.

name: Mizue
dialog: ... Enbi no Mikoto, who decided to rebel against Aka Oni, donned a red dress and hid a sharpened machete among its folds.

name: Mizue
dialog: She pretended to yield to the two brothers and was taken into their residence as a servant.

name: Mizue
dialog: Aka Oni and Ao Oni were satisfied with her service and gradually trusted her with more household chores, granting her access to their private space whenever she saw fit.

name: Mizue
dialog: During this time, she read about the origins of the two brothers in their library.

name: Mizue
dialog: She also found a painting stuck to a scarecrow that the brothers often beat up in anger. While she didn't understand its significance, she memorized every detail of the painting.

name: Mizue
dialog: One night, when Aka Oni was fast asleep, Enbi no Mikoto grasped her trusty machete and entered its quarters.

name: Mizue
dialog: In one firm slash, Aka Oni's head was separated from its body.

name: Mizue
dialog: Enbi no Mikoto turned to leave immediately but stopped in her tracks as she remembered the scars on the necks of the brothers, as well as the fact that despite being beheaded by the Gods before, they still lived.

name: Mizue
dialog: Before leaving the room, she set the scarecrow's head on the decapitated body of Aka Oni, covered it with a thick quilt, and hid Aka Oni's head in the folds of her dress.

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni, who was out earlier that night, saw her exit Aka Oni's room. It asked: "Was your dress always this red?"

name: Mizue
dialog: Enbi no Mikoto feigned calmness: "Yes, I've always worn a red dress."

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni didn't notice any evidence of foul play under the dim lights of the night and allowed Enbi no Mikoto to leave with its brother's head.

name: Uriel
dialog: Yesssss!
Everyone turned to Uriel, who shouted in triumph.
(Whispers) Shush! You're interrupting the story.

name: Uriel
dialog: I apologize for the disruption.

name: Chizuko
dialog: (Yells) YESSSSS!
Another yell, this time from Chizuko, drew attention to herself.
Huh, Chizuko shouted too. At least you're not the only one now.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Enbi no Mikoto escaped unscathed after slaying the horrendous monster. This is my favorite part of the story!

name: Mizue
dialog: I know. Your excitement when we arrive at this point of the story sure hasn't dimmed a bit despite how many times you have heard it.

name: Mizue
dialog: While it is nice to express your adoration of Enbi no Mikoto verbally, it is stopping me from proceeding with the tale.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Whoops. This won't happen again, I promise! I'll shout quietly next time! In my mind!

name: Uriel
dialog: (Whispers) Me too. This won't happen again.

name: Mizue
dialog: ... As I was saying, Enbi no Mikoto left the brothers' residence with Aka Oni's head. The people of Sawagi were overjoyed at the announcement that the menace was gone for good.

name: Mizue
dialog: Together, they burned Aka Oni's head to ashes, believing that the much-loathed droughts will not harm Sawagi again.

name: Mizue
dialog: As Ao Oni didn't share Aka Oni's enthusiasm in torturing the people of Sawagi, they didn't suffer as much with Aka Oni out of the picture.

name: Mizue
dialog: Although life in Sawagi was still a far cry from what it was, the people were content with what they managed to achieve.

name: Mizue
dialog: During this time, Ao Oni believed that Aka Oni was simply asleep from exhaustion. However, it grew worried when its brother never woke up.

name: Mizue
dialog: It flung the quilt off Aka Oni's bed, prepared to ask why Aka Oni was resting for such a long time, but the question died on its tongue as it saw its brother's beheaded body. All that remained in the place of the head was a bunch of hay.

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni rushed out of the room. As the brothers were connected by blood, it was able to locate Aka Oni's head with their link. Much to its dismay, it was led to a pile of ashes, indicating Aka Oni's fate.

name: Mizue
dialog: While they were immortal, regenerating their bodies will take months, even years.

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni sobbed uncontrollably as it realized that it will be parted with its brother for a long, long time.

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni's tears drew in heavy rain clouds, and Sawagi suffered from the downpour that ensued.

name: Mizue
dialog: The rivers overflowed, submerging the farmlands in floodwaters and robbing them of the ability to grow crops. What's worse, the floodwaters brought about pests and plague as well.

name: Mizue
dialog: The Sawagi people, who had just started to settle down again, started to panic, and plead Ao Oni to spare them.

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni promised to cease the endless rain in exchange for the murderer of its brother.

name: Mizue
dialog: They did not hesitate to sell Enbi no Mikoto out and delivered her to the hands of Ao Oni to appease it.

name: Mizue
dialog: ... And that's all for today. We'll delve further into the story and into the fate of Enbi no Mikoto tomorrow. I'd be glad to see you join us tomorrow too.
Thank you, we'd be honored to.
I can't believe the nerve of these people, turning their backs to Enbi no Mikoto like that. Don't you agree, Uriel... Uriel?

name: Uriel
dialog: This... this isn't right...
Are you okay? Your eyes are swollen and puffy.

name: Chizuko
dialog: It's just... I couldn't get the story out of my head and cried myself to sleep last night.

name: Uriel
dialog: I feel the same.
I thought you knew what happened to Enbi no Mikoto, Chizuko.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I do! It's just hard to not be saddened by this part of the story despite having heard it recited countless times…but I probably should pull myself together in front of guests. (Takes several deep breaths)

name: Chizuko
dialog: ... Whew! There, a lot better!

name: Chizuko
dialog: So, will the both of you be joining us again tonight?

name: Uriel
dialog: Of course! I have faith in Enbi no Mikoto; a strong woman like her wouldn't be stopped by hardships like this one, despite how daunting it seems.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Hmm... I'd hate to spoil the experience of hearing this story for the first time,

name: Chizuko
dialog: but I can assure you that no, this is not the end of her story.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I think we will reach the climax of the story today. I can't wait!
That's good to hear. Uriel can finally stop being so nervous and fidgety.

name: Uriel
dialog: Senpai! (Blushes)

name: Chizuko
dialog: By the way, where did you come from? I keep forgetting to ask...
We're from Yume Academy, and I'm her Senpai. Well, I'm the Senpai of almost everyone in the Academy.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Yume Academy? Is it far away from here?

name: Uriel
dialog: It's located south of the Wastelands of Foehn.

name: Chizuko
dialog: The Wastelands of Foehn... I think I read about it before. And you're from further away than that? Wow!
It would have taken us forever to arrive here if the Academy didn't provide us with some high-tech vehicles.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Oh! Have you seen cranes on your way here? I've never seen one before!

name: Uriel
dialog: Cranes? As in, the bird?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Yes! In fact, the Tsuruga Grand Shrine is named after the cranes! Well, the word for crane in the local tongue, that is.
I don't understand... if the shrine is named after them, then shouldn't they be fairly ordinary here?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Nope! We don't have cranes here. They are mythical creatures, you see, that only appear when the Gods descend to earth. According to legends, they are servants of God.

name: Chizuko
dialog: We've only seen paintings depicting them, but never in real life. Many of us believed that they only exist in stories and tales.

name: Chizuko
dialog: It isn't until we heard outsiders talking about them that we knew that they are real, living creatures.

name: Uriel
dialog: Well, that's not the case from where we came from. While they aren't too common, some can be found if you're in the right place at the right time. As a matter of fact, I've seen some from afar before.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Woah! Do they really have black and white feathers with a streak of red on their heads? Do they look as elegant as the ancient scrolls say?
I've never read your scrolls, so I'm not sure about the elegant part, but yes, that sounds like the cranes I've seen.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Just as the scrolls and tomes said! Cranes must have lived in the region before, or our predecessors wouldn't have drawn them this accurately.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I hope I can see one myself one day! Did I tell you that one of my dreams is touching the feathers of a crane? I'm named after them, you see, and they're my favorite!
Chizuko was brimming with excitement at learning more about cranes when a passerby crashed into her, causing her to fall to the ground with a yelp.
Tch. Get out of my way, brat.

name: Uriel
dialog: How rude! Come back here and apologize to Chizuko!
(I have a bad feeling about that person, but... I should help Chizuko now. This can wait.)
Are you alright, Chizuko? Here, I'll help you up.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Thank you! I'm just taken unawares. Look, not even a scratch!

name: Uriel
dialog: I memorized what he wore. I can drag him back here so he can apologize properly.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Oh no, you don't have to do that! I'm glad that you care, but I think it's partially my fault too; I wasn't paying attention to my surroundings.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Besides, he's gone for a while and he was wearing the uniform of his team. I don't think we can catch up to him or single him out from his team.
I heard the commotion. What happened, Chizuko?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Senior Priestess Kugatsu! Someone ran into me, and my friends here want them to apologize properly, that's all.

name: Senior Priestess
dialog: (Shakes head) These outsiders are getting out of line. I'll send them a warning.

name: Senior Priestess
dialog: And you are?
Hello! I am *, and this is Uriel.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: Good day. I am Kugatsu, Senior Priestess of the Tsuruga Grand Shrine.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Senior Priestess, * and Uriel weren't trying to disrupt the order or mean harm to the shrine. I can vouch for them!

name: Kugatsu
dialog: Don't worry, I'm not here to harass your friends.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: Although if memory serves me right, you are supposed to be helping with preparing the ceremony.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Whoops, it's time to get back to work already? I'll start right away, Senior Priestess.

title: (Yet Another) Story Night
name: Mizue
dialog: ... Enbi no Mikoto was betrayed by the Sawagi people, who handed her over to Ao Oni to appease its anger.

name: Mizue
dialog: As Aka Oni's head was burnt to ashes, Ao Oni wanted Enbi no Mikoto to suffer the same fate. It built a large pyre to ensure Enbi no Mikoto will not survive.

name: Mizue
dialog: Their foul deed did not change Enbi no Mikoto's devotion of protecting the people, so she walked willingly to the blazing fires.

name: Mizue
dialog: As she gazed at the flames, she was reminded of the painting that the brothers seemed to be averse to.
All the other Shrine Maidens, including Chizuko, joined Ms. Mizue in reciting the story.

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: Enbi no Mikoto had a revelation regarding the scene on the painting: it was an ancient and primal memory of the ancestors of Sawagi.

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: The painting depicted figures of dancers amid the tendrils of fire. Following their stances, Enbi no Mikoto started to dance as well.

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: It was close to impossible to tell that this was her first time going through this routine; the moves were smooth and graceful as she twisted and twirled unscathed in the flames meant to harm her.

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: All of a sudden, the sounds of birds flapping their wings could be heard, and a flock of black, white, and red birds appeared on the horizon.

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: They were cranes, and the flapping of their wings dispersed the rainclouds that Ao Oni summoned.

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: Homura-Ōmikami, the God watching over us all, sat among the cranes and rescued Enbi no Mikoto from the fire.

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: The people of Sawagi raised their heads in wonder, watching the first God to ever descend to the Sawagi lands, cradling Enbi no Mikoto in Their arms.

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: The dance of Enbi no Mikoto gradually became the practice we call Kagura dance today.

name: Mizue
dialog: Well, it's good to know that you haven't forgotten your heritage.
(Whispers) Just how many times have they heard this story to have it memorized down to every word??

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni was beyond frightened when Enbi no Mikoto began to dance, and rushed towards the ignited pyre.

name: Mizue
dialog: Much to its astonishment, the flames intending to take Enbi no Mikoto's life stopped its steps, and it couldn't get close to the dancing girl.

name: Mizue
dialog: Ao Oni forced itself to shed tears, summoning more rainclouds, but the rain failed to put out the fires.

name: Mizue
dialog: It had no choice but to wait for Enbi no Mikoto to finish her dance, sealing its fate by summoning Homura-Ōmikami.

name: Mizue
dialog: The battle between Homura-Ōmikami and Ao Oni lasted for seven days and seven nights. While Ao Oni had no power against Homura-Ōmikami, it had regeneration powers and fled whenever it could.

name: Mizue
dialog: In the end, Homura-Ōmikami called upon the powers of the sun, and Ao Oni was reduced to ashes.

name: Mizue
dialog: Unfortunately, Ao Oni's death didn't restore the ruined lands of Sawagi, where no crops could ever grow again.

name: Mizue
dialog: The Sawagi people prayed to Homura-Ōmikami to make the earth fertile again for the crops to grow. Enbi no Mikoto prayed as well.

name: Mizue
dialog: Moved by Enbi no Mikoto's pleas, Homura-Ōmikami ordered the cranes to fly across Sawagi, bringing life back to the land.

name: Mizue
dialog: However, the deeds of the Sawagi people couldn't go unpunished.

name: Mizue
dialog: The farmlands of Sawagi never returned to their former fertility, and the people had to work diligently to feed themselves.

name: Mizue
dialog: Before Homura-Ōmikami returned to the heavens, They ordered Enbi no Mikoto to build a shrine for Them.

name: Mizue
dialog: Enbi no Mikoto named the shrine Tsuruga, after the cranes that were servants of the Deity.

name: Mizue
dialog: ... And this is how the Tsuruga Grand Shrine came into being.

name: Uriel
dialog: Whew! I'm glad that everything turned out okay for Enbi no Mikoto.
To be honest, I was expecting to learn more about the trials.

name: Uriel
dialog: Now that you mention it...
Ms. Mizue walked towards us as if she had overheard our conversation.

name: Mizue
dialog: Homura-Ōmikami may have defeated Ao Oni, but the brothers were immortal, and the danger still existed.

name: Mizue
dialog: Come back again tomorrow; the story is far from over yet.
We will.

name: Izanami
dialog: We used to walk under the moonlight, holding hands all the while... but you're not here now, Izanagi.

name: Izanami
dialog: There was no trace of you ever having returned; why did you stay away? Have you forgotten all about me? About us?

name: Izanami
dialog: I will find you, Izanagi... No matter where you have gone.

name: Athena
dialog: Izanami!

name: Izanami
dialog: ... Athena. This better be important.

name: Athena
dialog: I have a message from Kratos. She heard that Yume Academy sent students here to the Tsuruga Grand Shrine. Since you're already here...

name: Izanami
dialog: I am only here to seek Izanagi. This was our homeland; I will not taint the fond memories I have of this place.

name: Athena
dialog: But Kratos ordered...

name: Izanami
dialog: Enough. Just tell her what I said. I am not obliged to follow her orders.

name: Izanami
dialog: For your safety, I would suggest not taking any rash actions when you're in the Shrine. It is not unguarded.

name: Athena
dialog: ... As you wish. I have another report to make: I discovered traces of Chaos activity here. I suspect it has already infiltrated the shrine.

name: Izanami
dialog: Chaos!

name: Izanami
dialog: I understand. If the Chaos have the misfortune of running into me... I will end them.

name: Izanami
dialog: ... I hear footsteps. We will be getting company soon. If there are no more reports, I will be taking my leave.

name: Athena
dialog: That was the last. I wish you well, Izanami.

name: Uriel
dialog: What will happen next? I hope Enbi no Mikoto lived happily ever after in the end.

name: Uriel
dialog: ... Senpai? Senpai? Have you been listening to anything I said in the last minute?
I'm sorry, Uriel, but I swear I saw the same person several days ago. I can't seem to remember her identity though.

title: Names
name: Chizuko
dialog: *, over here~

name: Chizuko
dialog: What brings you here today? And where's Uriel?
Ah, she's still asleep. Apparently, she was up all night being excited for Enbi no Mikoto and only fell asleep at sunrise, so it's just me today. What are you doing?

name: Chizuko
dialog: We're preparing for the Ceremony! It will be held at night three days later. Will you be there?
I wouldn't miss it for anything! I'll tell Uriel about this too. What happens at this Ceremony?

name: Chizuko
dialog: It's a huge event! It's more like a Festival, now that I think about it: Food Stalls, Game Stalls... And we would also be having a Kagura Dance Performance!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Us Shrine Maidens tried to follow the historical texts as best as possible, but it's probably not the same routine that Enbi no Mikoto went through. I can guarantee you that it's still amazing though!

name: Chizuko
dialog: I've always wanted to perform, but I can't since I'm not an official Shrine Maiden yet. That, and I need a lot more practice before I'm deemed worthy!
I'm sure you will be able to sometime soon. I can't wait to see you on stage!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Thank you! By the way, you said you know Mami, right? Look, there she is!
As I turned towards the direction Chizuko was gesturing to, I saw Mami, Ms. Mizue, Senior Priestess Kugatsu, and the young shrine maiden who saved us seats during the lecture.
Suddenly, my eyes met with Mami's cautious ones. Her expression soured.
Oh no, Mami wouldn't be happy with me for befriending Chizuko...

name: Mami
dialog: Chizuko, what are you doing with this imbecile?
Ouch, you didn't have to be so harsh!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Hm? Aren't you friends with *, Mami?

name: Mami
dialog: Ugh, no. What nonsense have you been filling Chizuko's head with?

name: Mizue
dialog: Mamiko, you should be kinder to your friends.
Ms. Mizue, her name is Mami, not Mamiko.

name: Mizue
dialog: Keiko? What did you just say? What about Mamiko?

name: Keiko
dialog: I said, her name is Mami, not Mamiko!

name: Mizue
dialog: Oh yes, Mami, Mami, that's her name. Old age has chipped away at my hearing, I'm afraid.
Mamiko? Sounds like a cute name, and makes you and Chizuko seem more like sisters-Ouch!

name: Keiko
dialog: (Headbutts *) NOT MAMIKO! MAMI!

name: Mami
dialog: Good job, Keiko! And Ms. Mizue...I am by no means friends with this outsider.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: And you probably shouldn't be. We shouldn't be too trusting of outsiders, Ms. Mizue.

name: Mizue
dialog: Haha, you worry too much, Kugatsu. Old age has done a number on my hearing, but not on my sight nor my judge of character: I can see that this youngster here is good at heart.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: ...If you say so, Ms. Mizue.
Aww, I'm so touched, Ms. Mizue! By the way, why does Senior Priestess Kugatsu treat Ms. Mizue so respectfully? I thought she was the leader of this Shrine?

name: Mami
dialog: Ms. Mizue is the Head Priestess of Tsuruga Grand Shrine. While Senior Priestess Kugatsu manages most worldly matters now, all of us respect Ms. Mizue very much.
I can see that, since your attitude towards me softened remarkably when Ms. Mizue came up. I have another question: why does Keiko opposes calling you Mamiko so vehemently?

name: Keiko
dialog: Everyone's name ends with "-ko" in the Shrine. Mami is one of the precious few whose name doesn't follow this pattern, and I don't want her to change her name!
Lemme think, I know five people from this Shrine, and the only two whose names end in "-ko" are Chizuko and Keiko. That's not a lot.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Well, we also have Tamako, Chiko, Kyouko, Sakurako...Keiko and I are not the only ones with names like that.

name: Keiko
dialog: We were orphans when the Shrine took us in. Ms. Mizue named all of us, which is why all our names end with "-ko".

name: Keiko
dialog: Mami is different: it's the name her parents gave her. It shouldn't be changed to be like us.

name: Mami
dialog: Most Shrine Maidens in the Shrine were abandoned by their parents. As for myself...I arrived after my parents passed away.

name: Mami
dialog: Keiko still has faith in parents, and seems to believe that as long as the name doesn't end in "-ko", the child isn't abandoned.
I'm sorry to hear that. So Chizuko was...

name: Mami
dialog: ...Yes, but different. Usually, families who couldn't afford to raise a child will send their daughters here. We've never met Chizuko's parents: she was found in front of the Shrine's gates.

name: Mami
dialog: It was snowing that day. If I wasn't sent to run errands out of the Shrine, I wouldn't have found her in time...but she was still left in the snow for far too long. I believe the over-exposure to the cold has affected her health.
So all of them were orphans...I see why Mami cares so much about Chizuko now: she was the one who found her in the snow.
All thanks to Enbi no Mikoto, they have a place to call home now. I should check back on Uriel to see whether she's up. It's probably time for us to visit Ms. Mizue for more stories.
...Wait, isn't that... I know you!
You're...Izanami, right?

name: Izanami
dialog: Observer of Yume. I wasn't planning on meeting you so soon, but since you have so generously given yourself up…
(Uriel isn't here... I'm not sure if I can best her in battle.)

name: Izanami
dialog: You don't have to look so alarmed; I wasn't planning on actually fighting you in the Shrine.
So you will do so when we're not in the confines of it? I'll take note of that when we eventually leave here. It's a truce now, right?

name: Izanami
dialog: You shouldn't trust the words of your enemy. I could be waiting for you to lower your guard and strike when you're least expecting me to.
But you're not doing that, are you? Besides, I can feel the waves of depression that are rolling off of you right now...

name: Izanami
dialog: This is why I detest those like you: way too perceptive for your own good... But that's not what I'm here for. Have you, by chance, met my Izanagi?
Izanami described Izanagi's appearance in meticulous detail.
I don't think I've ever met someone like that, sorry. Is she important to you? I'd ask the others if they have seen her.

name: Izanami
dialog: She is my beloved... While I highly doubt that you can, if you manage to reunite us, I can leave Kratos' forces and join Yume.

name: Izanami
dialog: Now off you go: you should be heading to the Shrine Office for stories at this hour of the day.
How do you know that?? Have you been stalking me??

title: Origin of the Trials
name: Uriel
dialog: Oh my... I can't believe I overslept. This is unbecoming behavior for a knight...

name: Uriel
dialog: I missed training too... I should wake up earlier tomorrow to make up for what I missed today.
Hey, hey, don't be too hard on yourself. A character you like very much got the happy ending she deserved, and you're excited because of this. It's understandable.

name: Uriel
dialog: She reminds me of Belinus, of what might have happened if... but that has nothing to do with slacking off at training!

name: Uriel
dialog: It will become a habit if I am not careful.

name: Mizue
dialog: ...As I said last time, Homura-Ōmikami slew Ao Oni, and ordered Enbi no Mikoto to establish a Shrine in Their honor.

name: Mizue
dialog: Yet Ao Oni and Aka Oni are immortal; they draw energy from negative emotions, and will eventually regenerate their destroyed bodies and bring doom to Sawagi.

name: Mizue
dialog: Homura-Ōmikami imparted the knowledge that the amount of time the two brothers need to recover depends on the extent of damage done to their corpses.

name: Mizue
dialog: To prolong their recovery, Homura-Ōmikami burned Aka Oni's body to ashes as well.

name: Mizue
dialog: The ashes of the two brothers were sealed in another plane of existence created by the God, and it is only accessible from a room in the Shrine.

name: Mizue
dialog: From their remains, their energies manifest as brutal monsters. Defeating such monsters will also help against their revival.

name: Mizue
dialog: Entering the plane that we call the "Realm of Trials" to battle the monsters is an age-old tradition of our Shrine.

name: Mizue
dialog: Shrine Maidens of Tsuruga as well as courageous people of Sawagi braved the Realm of Trials to engage in combat with the monsters, hoping to lengthen the time the Brothers needed to recover.

name: Mizue
dialog: However, they were horribly outnumbered by the monsters, and casualties were large. Enbi no Mikoto prayed to Homura-Ōmikami, pleading the God for assistance.

name: Mizue
dialog: In response to Enbi no Mikoto's prayers, Homura-Ōmikami created two artifacts:

name: Mizue
dialog: One of them is the Pond of Prayers. It takes the shape of a regular Pond, but is in fact a bottomless reserve of treasures and artifacts.

name: Mizue
dialog: True to its name, it will grant every wish and prayer.

name: Mizue
dialog: However, it does not allow everyone to tap into its resources. This is where the second artifact, the "Gaze of Gods", comes in.

name: Mizue
dialog: The "Gaze of Gods" is rumored to be a mirror that reflects nothing. One can reach into the mirror and obtain a key to the Pond of Prayers.

name: Mizue
dialog: It is said that if you see yourself reflected in the "Gaze of Gods", it means that God is watching you through the mirror.

name: Mizue
dialog: The mirror was entrusted to Enbi no Mikoto, who never hesitated to share the keys to challengers of the Trials.

name: Mizue
dialog: The keys were shaped similar to the cranes who served the God, hence their name "Origami Cranes", or paper-folded cranes.

name: Mizue
dialog: Back in the time, we believed those were rewards granted to the brave, and called them "Symbols of Approval".

name: Mizue
dialog: With treasures and artifacts from the Pond of Prayers, the challengers finally stood a chance against the monsters in the Realm of Trials.

name: Uriel
dialog: Ah, so that's how the Trials and the Pond of Prayers came to be...
Does this mean that with the "Gaze of Gods", one can gain access to endless amounts of treasures?

name: Mizue
dialog: Enbi no Mikoto showed no discrimination when distributing the "Symbols of Approval", as long as the challengers were willing to enter the Realm of Trials.

name: Mizue
dialog: However, not everyone held noble intentions; some greedy challengers left as soon as the treasure came into their possession without taking on the monsters.

name: Mizue
dialog: Infuriated, Enbi no Mikoto took the treasure back from the challengers that brought the treasure away from the Shrine, and stopped distributing "Symbols of Approval" freely. The treasure will only be granted moments before entering the Realm of Trials, and will be taken away once the challengers return from the Trials.

name: Uriel
dialog: Oh no... I don't believe the challengers will be happy with this change.

name: Mizue
dialog: One night, a bunch of evil-willed challengers gathered with the sole aim to kill Enbi no Mikoto and pry the "Gaze of Gods" from her cold, dead hands.

name: Mizue
dialog: The Shrine Maidens were unfortunately outnumbered, and those who could fight were worn out by the constant fights in the Realm of Trials. They were no match for the challengers.

name: Mizue
dialog: Severely wounded, Enbi no Mikoto could only escape to the Realm of Trials with the "Gaze of Gods".

name: Mizue
dialog: The last thing she did was to shatter the mirror and toss the shards into the Realm of Trials so the challengers couldn't get to them.

name: Mizue
dialog: As all hope of getting their hands on the sacred artifact was lost, the challengers left the Shrine in defeat. Since then, shards of the "Gaze of Gods" were scattered about in the Realm of Trials, never to be seen again.

name: Mizue
dialog: The only method to obtain the treasures and "Symbols of Approval" was to enter the Realm of Trials and take on the Trials.
What an unbelievable end to this story...

name: Uriel
dialog: Why, Enbi no Mikoto, why... Why is it always the ones that shine as bright as the sun that suffer such fates...

name: Mizue
dialog: When the first rays of the sun fell upon Enbi no Mikoto's body, she turned into a crane and flew away.

name: Mizue
dialog: We believe that she was yet again saved by Homura-Ōmikami, and ascended into the heavens to live happily ever after.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Here you are, I have been looking for you! I guess Uriel cried again at this part of the story, am I right?
And you didn't? I remember you were devastated when Enbi no Mikoto was sold out by the people she sworn to protect. That's unexpected.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I don't think Enbi no Mikoto died.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I believe that God saved her and brought her to the heavens to live happily ever after, just like Ms. Mizue said!

name: Uriel
dialog: Do you really believe that? That sounds awfully self-deluding...

name: Chizuko
dialog: But Homura-Ōmikami exists and They adore Enbi no Mikoto! They won't allow Enbi no Mikoto to waste away like that!

name: Chizuko
dialog: God must have wanted her to live in a better world than this one.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I mean, Homura-Ōmikami could descend to the mortal world anytime if Enbi no Mikoto asked her to, and no mortal could stand against the wraith of Gods, right?

name: Chizuko
dialog: At least, that's what I want to believe.
You have a point. With the level of affection the God has shown her, I wouldn't be surprised if any miracles happened.

name: Uriel
dialog: I guess so, but I still feel indignant for Enbi no Mikoto. She was a good person, and didn't deserve what the others did to her.

name: Uriel
dialog: But I suppose I can see it coming... The greedy ones won't be happy with Enbi no Mikoto's decision.

name: Chizuko
dialog: According to "The Chronicles of Tsuruga", Enbi no Mikoto was only sixteen or seventeen at the time. It's perfectly understandable if her choices weren't very well thought-out.
It's a pity that the "Gaze of Gods" is now lost. Imagine the amount of treasure you'd have if it's still in your possession!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Well, you're not the first one to think like that. But anyone who causes mischief in the Shrine will be punished gravely!
Gaze of Gods, hm? It will be mine!

title: Broken Trust
dialog: The next day, I passed the information we gathered so far to Ithil and KongMing.
...And that's all we've learned since we arrived here.

name: KongMing's Projection
dialog: While the credibility of their story is doubtful, it can be deduced that the only method of obtaining the treasure is challenging the Trials.

name: Ithil's Projection
dialog: But so far, they are the only source of information that we have. They might very well be making up a story to hide the true source of the treasure.

name: Ithil's Projection
dialog: ...Which I suspect is still hidden somewhere in the Tsuruga Grand Shrine.

name: Uriel
dialog: I don't know, the story seems plausible enough for me. Ithil's theory sounds a bit paranoid, to be honest.

name: KongMing's Projection
dialog: No matter what the truth is, it is probably not common knowledge among the Shrine Maidens.

name: KongMing's Projection
dialog: It's highly possible that only the Head Priestess and Senior Priestess are privy to that knowledge. From how Senpai described them, I doubt that they will be willing to reveal the secret to us.
Why not? The Yume Academy is clearly the good guys... I mean girls, that fight against the Chaos.
Surely we can convince the Shrine to supply us with some treasure, can't we? There's no need to go behind their backs.

name: KongMing's Projection
dialog: (Sighs) Secrets are meant to be kept, Senpai. They wouldn't be secrets otherwise. As the most well-kept secret of the Tsuruga Grand Shrine, the probabilities of them sharing it with us are very low.

name: Ithil's Projection
dialog: So far, the amount of treasure we have gathered from the Trials is inadequate for our cause, and time is not on our side.

name: Ithil's Projection
dialog: It would be to our advantage to find the source and try to replicate it here at Yume Academy.
... This doesn't sit well with me. Chizuko and Mami are kind and honest people. I'm sure they will be able to see from our perspective if we explained the situation to them.
It wouldn't hurt to maintain good relationships with members of the Shrine. Since the Shrine Maidens are guardians of the Shrine, they might even be able to assist us in clearing the Trials.

name: Uriel
dialog: Like how Mami gave me tips on fighting before!

name: Ithil's Projection
dialog: ... You're the Senpai, I suppose. If you've made up your mind on this, we'll follow your lead.
Thank you, Ithil.

name: Mami
dialog: Hmm? Isn't that * and Uriel? Why are they hiding in a corner? Are they speaking to someone?

name: Mami
dialog: The most well-kept secret..."treasure"..."be on good relationships with members of the Shrine"… What is this?

name: Mami
dialog: I am a fool to have thought that you were different from the other outsiders. You outsiders are all greedy and ungrateful brutes who are here for the treasure only!
What? No, Mami, why are you...

name: Mami
dialog: I overheard your schemes: your friendly act was only a disguise so you could steal the secret of the treasures from us!

name: Mami
dialog: As no harm has been done yet, the Shrine's rules forbid me from taking any action.

name: Mami
dialog: But I will be watching you. The moment you start something shady, I will be sure to make you regret every life choice of yours that led you to Tsuruga Grand Shrine. Hmph!
Please, Mami, this is not what it looks like...

name: Uriel
dialog: It's a misunderstanding, Mami, we can explain...
Oh no, she just left without hearing us out. What should we do now?
And I was so close to befriending her...

name: Chizuko
dialog: *, Uriel! What are you doing in this secluded corner? And why do you look so dejected?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Did anything bad happen? If you are in the mood to talk, I'm all ears. I heard it's therapeutic to say what's bothering you out loud!
Mami is mad at us, and I don't know what to do...

name: Uriel
dialog: There was a misunderstanding that we need to clear up. Do you know where we can find her?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Erm, if Mami doesn't want to be found, I can guarantee you that no one will find her. I can try to pass on a message for you though!
Thank you, Chizuko, but I think we should explain to her in person to avoid any more misunderstandings.
Is it possible to arrange a meeting with her? Please? If she refuses to meet us, then I suppose we would have no choice but to write her a letter and hope that it reaches her.

name: Chizuko
dialog: It's...hard, but not impossible, I think. Mami likes me a lot, and if I beg her, she might relent.

name: Chizuko
dialog: It's not every day that you see Mami being on speaking terms with outsiders, and I think it's doing her a lot of good. I want all of you, especially her, to be happy, so I'll try my best!
You're a lifesaver, Chizuko. We're relying on you.

name: Uriel
dialog: I hope Chizuko can convince Mami to meet us...

If she can't, then our only option is to leave her a letter, hoping that she'll actually read it. Anyhow, we must do our best to clear up this misunderstanding. We are not the greedy outsiders that she seems to believe us to be.

name: Izanami
dialog: We meet again, Observer.

name: Uriel
dialog: Be on guard, Senpai; she is a member of Krato's forces.

name: Izanami
dialog: You haven't mentioned our encounter to your bodyguard, have you?
It's okay, Uriel, I met her before. She wouldn't make a move on us now.

name: Uriel
dialog: What?! When did this happen?
On the day you overslept.

name: Uriel
dialog: Do you have any idea how dangerous this is, Senpai? She could have killed you or seriously hurt you, and I would be blaming myself for shirking my responsibilities for the rest of my life!
Relax, Uriel. I'm here and unscathed, am I not?

name: Izanami
dialog: Hm, as entertaining as this was, shouldn't you be off to the storytelling session of the Shrine Maidens at this hour? What's keeping you?
Yeah, about that...apparently we're bad, greedy people that have eyes only on the secrets of the Shrine now. In fact, Mami might be telling Ms. Mizue about us right now.
So, probably not the best time for us to show up.

name: Izanami
dialog: Secrets of the Shrine... You are talking about the "Gaze of Gods", aren't you?

name: Uriel
dialog: Wait, you know about it too?

name: Izanami
dialog: Oh, I saw it in its full glory. Since you're not going to hear this story from the Shrine Maidens, you might as well hear it from me.

name: Izanami
dialog: After all, I do know a thing or two about what happened afterwards.

title: Story time with Izanami
name: Izanami
dialog: I can't remember the exact period of time when it happened, only that it happened long after Homura-Ōmikami swept Enbi no Mikoto away from the mortal world.

name: Izanami
dialog: At that time, the Deity frequently made its presence known, sending messages to Shrine Maidens or causing miracles to happen.
Huh, that's oddly detailed. One would think that you have actually lived through all this from the way you're telling this story.

name: Izanami
dialog: And what if I have?

name: Uriel
dialog: Really? So is it true that Enbi no Mikoto isn't dead, just far away from here?

name: Izanami
dialog: She might be.

name: Uriel
dialog: Why do I feel like you're just trying to brush me aside?

name: Izanami
dialog: One day, Ao Oni and Aka Oni reappeared to the astonishment of everyone.

name: Izanami
dialog: The Shrine Maidens estimated that it would have taken more time for them to revive. Not only have they revived before the expected time, but they were also more powerful than before.

name: Uriel
dialog: Ugh, those two again. Why did that happen?

name: Izanami
dialog: Because of Chaos. They drew power from Chaos, which sped up their regeneration.
You don't do cliffhangers, do you?

name: Izanami
dialog: What for? You wanted to know what happened, and I'm telling you. If you wanted a storyteller, you'd have to look elsewhere.
No, no, please continue. You mentioned Chaos, right? Just how far back in history do the Chaos go?

name: Izanami
dialog: It's a mystery. After the monsters left the Realm of Trials, a mirror flew out of the Realm and landed in the hands of the then Head Priestess.

name: Izanami
dialog: Rumor went that the "Gaze of Gods" will only appear at the Brothers' resurrection.

name: Izanami
dialog: However, the treasure was ineffective against the monsters themselves. Allied with the forces of Chaos, the Brothers set out to take revenge on those that tried to stop their revival.

name: Izanami
dialog: At times, they submerged Sawagi with water, and other times they wrecked the land with droughts. The Forces of Chaos took the opportunity to harvest as many human lives as they could.

name: Izanami
dialog: The Sawagi people were not worried at first. After all, they had their own God watching over their home.

name: Izanami
dialog: They gradually lost their confidence as the Deity failed to resPond no matter how much the Shrine Maidens prayed.

name: Izanami
dialog: In their panic, they flocked to the Shrine for refuge. It was the only establishment with the ability to protect everyone, with a team of Shrine Maidens trained specially to fight against the monsters in the Realm of Trials.

name: Izanami
dialog: Most made it to the Shrine. Some unfortunate ones didn't.
Izanami paused in her narration, absentmindedly touching the purple crystals on her face.
A tear slipped from her eye as she lost herself in her memories, muttering to a person that left her and broke her heart:

name: Izanami
dialog: Izanagi, Izanagi... Don't look at me...

name: Izanami
dialog: I am not infected by Chaos... I am not deformed... I will find a cure, as you wished...

name: Izanami
dialog: Don't leave...

name: Uriel
dialog: W-What's going on, Senpai? She looks distressed.

name: Uriel
dialog: (Whispers) From what she's saying, this Izanagi person left her because they thought she was "deformed"?
(Whispers) She told me that Izanagi was her lover.
Snap out of it, Izanami! Izanagi is not here!

name: Izanami
dialog: No... You are not here... Where have you gone? I will find you again, Izanagi...

name: Uriel
dialog: This isn't right... No matter who this Izanagi person is, they shouldn't have left their beloved because they were infected and scarred by Chaos.

name: Uriel
dialog: ...Wait a minute, what if this is another misunderstanding, just like Mami and us?

name: Uriel
dialog: Perhaps that is not the whole truth...

name: Uriel
dialog: Yes, Izanagi might have left you without a goodbye, but what if they caught wind of a cure, and had to leave at once or risk losing the lead?

name: Uriel
dialog: And they never returned because they haven't found the cure and vowed not to return until they have done so. They wanted your reunion to be a happy one.

name: Izanami
dialog: Is that so... Is this why you never returned, Izanagi? Because you love me?
It's likely!
(Whispers) Are you sure? She looks hopeful.

name: Uriel
dialog: (Whispers) Not really, but the possibility exists.

name: Uriel
dialog: (Whispers) Besides, if Izanagi truly abandoned her, then I highly doubt that they will ever meet each other again. What's the harm in letting her have some hope?

name: Uriel
dialog: Chizuko's positivity is infectious; I want to believe that there is potential for every story to lead to a happy ending. Even yours, Izanami.

name: Izanami
dialog: Hmph, I know that you're just trying to comfort me, but you did open my eyes to the possibility.

name: Izanami
dialog: If we meet on opposite sides of the battlefield next time, I can spare your lives once.
Gee, thanks, I feel so loved. I'd appreciate it a lot if we don't end up as enemies though.

name: Izanami
dialog: ... We should continue with the story. The Shrine Maidens never lost hope, and prayed to Homura-Ōmikami day and night.

name: Izanami
dialog: Finally, The Deity resPonded to their prayers: the sun rose at midnight with the shrill chirp of a crane one night.

name: Izanami
dialog: Bright rays of dawn chased away the night that enveloped Sawagi, and the Brothers were yet again reduced to ashes when sunlight fell upon them.

name: Izanami
dialog: The people say that the sun was the manifestation of Homura-Ōmikami, and the crane that flew beside the sun as it climbed above the horizon was Enbi no Mikoto.

name: Izanami
dialog: The Forces of Chaos were vanquished, and the ashes of Ao Oni and Aka Oni were returned to the Shrine.

name: Izanami
dialog: The Shrine Maidens sealed both their ashes and the "Gaze of Gods" back into the Realm of Trials.

name: Izanami
dialog: After renovations to the buildings wrecked by the Brothers' breakout were finished, Tsuruga Grand Shrine hosted a Grand Ceremony to express their thanks to the God, yet received no response.

name: Izanami
dialog: In fact, that was the last time the God was seen in Sawagi.

name: Izanami
dialog: However, the Sawagi people believed that Homura-Ōmikami never left them, since the Pond of Prayers still functioned as before.
And you lived through all of this? Wow...

name: Izanami
dialog: Some are my own experiences, and others I gathered from the locals when I returned later.

name: Izanami
dialog: I do not trust that God: They are not as good and noble as the Sawagi people believe Them to be.

name: Izanami
dialog: All They want was the faith of Their disciples: if They did care, They could have destroyed the Chaos anytime! And I would never be deformed by these vile scars!

name: Uriel
dialog: I-I think I have heard about this. Before I came to Yume Academy, that is.

name: Uriel
dialog: When I still belonged to the Order of the Sun, a senior knight once told me that her team was assigned to defend a region against Chaos, and to take down a God that has taken residence there.

name: Uriel
dialog: However, the Chaos were destroyed when they arrived. The locals said it was a miracle.

name: Uriel
dialog: They investigated and found that the God died protecting the land from Chaos.

name: Uriel
dialog: Now that I think about it... She said that the land was named "Sawagi".

name: Uriel
dialog: I don't know why They didn't take any action against the Chaos in the beginning. Perhaps it wrongly believed that the Chaos was no match for it... and paid dearly for this misjudgment.

name: Izanami
dialog: Homura-Ōmikami died... protecting us? I, I don't...
(Cackles) Ah, Ahhh, so the Brothers' resurrection is tied to the "Gaze of Gods"... I know just the thing to do now!

title: "Yume Academy"
dialog: （Bells clanging)
Arrgh... Go away...

name: Uriel
dialog: No time for sleeping, Senpai! Those are emergency alarms. Get up!
H-huh? What's going on?
Can anyone fill me in on the situation? Why is everyone running?

name: Kugatsu
dialog: (Shouting) There has been a breach of security in the Realm of Trials! Please stay away from the entrance and leave the premises as soon as possible!

name: Kugatsu
dialog: I repeat, please steer clear of the entrance and leave the premises!

name: Uriel
dialog: A breach of security...? Sounds ominous, especially when Ao Oni and Aka Oni is involved.

name: Uriel
dialog: Look, a group of Shrine Maidens is approaching the entrance to the Realm of Trials instead of escaping from it!
Oh no, Mami is among them too! We must help her!

name: Kugatsu
dialog: Stop right there! If you want to leave unscathed, you should be running away from the Realm of Trials, not towards it.
But... But... Mami and the others are heading towards the Realm too! Why aren't you stopping them?!

name: Kugatsu
dialog: They are trained and prepared for situations like this one. You are not.
We can still help! We've cleared the Trials repeatedly now.

name: Uriel
dialog: We consider Mami as a friend, and we will never leave a friend in need. If there is anything that we can help with, we will do it.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: ... I suppose I should trust Ms. Mizue's judgment this time. Don't make me regret this.
You won't.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: Mami belongs to a special force of Shrine Maidens, the Blazing Eagles.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: The Brothers sealed in the Realm of Trials are showing signs of resurrection, and the Blazing Eagles are sent to buy time for everyone else to escape.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: We are no match for them. Without Homura-Ōmikami's assistance, we have no chance of winning.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: To make matters worse, the Beasts of Chaos have appeared by their side just like what happened in the past.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: This is the last chance for you to change your minds. You can still choose to leave and to live.
Well, I don't know about Monsters, but Chaos Beasts are right in our area of expertise.

name: Uriel
dialog: After all, we're from the Yume Academy!
Uriel, I need you to gather the other Girls who were sent here so we can take on the Chaos Beasts together.
I will join forces with Mami.

name: Uriel
dialog: Are you certain? The Realm of Trials is not safe now... I can always go in your place, and the Girls will resPond to your orders faster than mine.
We don't have time for this argument, Uriel. Trust me; I won't go down that easily.

name: Uriel
dialog: ... If you insist. Be safe, Senpai.

name: Izanami
dialog: Listen to your Senpai, young Knight. I'll make sure your Senpai returns to you safe and sound.
Wha-Izanami?!

name: Mami
dialog: Take this, you brute! This broom is gifted to me by Homura-Ōmikami, and works best against vile creatures like you!
Mami!

name: Mami
dialog: Ugh, you again. Go away, I don't have time to deal with you now.

name: Mami
dialog: And why is another girl accompanying you instead of Uriel? Did you ditch her?

name: Izanami
dialog: Oh, no. I have no intentions of starting another relationship just yet.
It's not what it looks like between Izanami and me! And we're here to help!

name: Mami
dialog: Help? We're here as a suicide squad, not as treasure hunters!

name: Mami
dialog: Treasure seekers like you should be running for your lives, not towards danger.
I know you don't trust me after what you overheard, but please let us help you.
I am the Observer of Yume Academy and am experienced in dealing with Chaos Creatures.
Besides, we never did clear up that misunderstanding yet, and we can't do that if you're six feet under, can we?

name: Mami
dialog: You... Fine, if we end up pulling through, I will listen to what you have to say. No promises on forgiveness though.
It's a date!

name: Izanami
dialog: If you are done with flirting, I can use some help dealing with these Chaos Beasts here.

name: Izanami
dialog: You'd think people would be more considerate when you're separated from your lover, but no, they have to rub salt in the wound... (Mutters)

name: Mami
dialog: I'm not... We're not... Ugh. Let's get this over with.

name: Yume Academy Students
dialog: We're here to help!

name: Uriel
dialog: I rounded up everyone I could find. I hope we're not too late...
Nope, you're right on time!
Annnnd now, it's time to show these Monsters and Chaos Beasts why it's a bad idea to mess with Yume Academy!

title: Michinashi
dialog: Gwen, Brigit, mind giving that Shrine Maiden over there a hand? She looks overwhelmed.

name: Gwen & Brigit
dialog: On it~\nO butterfly, fluttereth thy wings!
Von Helsing, behind you!

name: Von Helsing
dialog: Too slow... It's hunting time.
Angelica, I need you to take care of the Chaos Beasts on the western front!

name: Angelica
dialog: Consider it done... My arrows shall bring me honor!
Holly, what's the status of the wounded?

name: Holly
dialog: Don't worry, Senpai, everyone in the forest is with me~

name: Mami
dialog: Huh, you weren't bluffing about being professionals.
I am really tempted to say something obnoxious like "I told you so" right now…

name: Mami
dialog: Yeah, yeah, rub it in. If you're such a hotshot, then you wouldn't turn down some friendly competition to see who takes down more Monsters and Chaos Beasts, will you?

name: Mami
dialog: I'll even let you have a head start since I'm well-trained to take down those Monsters.
You might be, but what about those Chaos Beasts? I have way more experience dealing with them than you.

name: Mami
dialog: Hmph, we'll see.
Tch, where did these losers come from? I could have overwhelmed those Shrine Maidens easily...
Can they be from the Yume Academy that are rumored to have defeated Dire and Magma Demon?
Ao Oni and Aka Oni are useless; with the amount of Chaotic Energy that they have absorbed, they should be revived now, but no.
I wouldn't have given them this much of my powers if it wasn't for the "Gaze of Gods".
Those fools only have their eyes on the treasure from the Pond of Prayers, overlooking the "Gaze of Gods", which is an impressive artifact itself.
Ah, I know just what to do to hasten the rebirth of these two Brothers...
What's going on?! We had the situation under control, but these Monsters and Chaos Beasts came out of nowhere!

name: Mami
dialog: (Pants heavily) Us Shrine Maidens have been working with the challengers to fight against the waves of Monsters through the years. We've never fully vanquished them.

name: Mami
dialog: However, the energies from the negative emotions aren't enough for the Brothers to revive yet. The Monsters must have been stirred up by the Chaos...

name: Mami
dialog: I thought we would be able to pull through with your help since this is Chaos-related.

name: Mami
dialog: ... But it seems like I am wrong.
...Something doesn't add up. I don't know much about Monsters, the Brothers, or energies from negative emotions, but the Chaos Beasts are not acting the way they should.

name: Izanami
dialog: That is true. These Chaos Beasts are overexerting themselves with a clear aim, while they usually go after any trace of energy mindlessly.

name: Izanami
dialog: There must be another intelligent Chaos being manipulating them, one that overpowers the regular Chaos Beasts.
Powerful and intelligent Chaos Creature... This sounds awfully like another Chaos Lord.

name: Mami
dialog: A Chaos Lord?
A higher being among the Forces of Chaos... We've slain two already, and we can certainly defeat a third one.
It shouldn't be too far away if it is controlling these Chaos Beast. Girls, can you check for anything out of place?

name: Gwen & Brigit
dialog: All clear on the eastern and southern fronts!

name: Angelica
dialog: Nothing in the west either.

name: Uriel
dialog: Senpai, I spotted a suspicious entity in the north!
We're on our way!
You.
Wait, a human? But you are oozing Chaotic Energy...
Ah, you must be referring to this human body. A rather useful one, I'd say, especially when I need to stay under the radar.
As you have found me, it has exhausted its usefulness. As a reward... I shall reveal to you my true name and form.

name: Michinashi
dialog: I am Michinashi, a Chaos Lord. Learn to fear this name, and cower when it is uttered.
A Chaos Lord!

name: Izanami
dialog: Strange, it seems weaker than other Chaos Lords...

name: Izanami
dialog: Though what it lacks in strength is probably made up for in stealth. I wouldn't complain; it does make my life easier.

name: Uriel
dialog: Repent your sins to the rays of the sun, vile creature…

name: Uriel
dialog: ... And regret every decision that led you to defile the land that Enbi no Mikoto vowed to protect!

title: Kagura Dance
name: Michinashi
dialog: No! I refuse to accept this!

name: Michinashi
dialog: Puny humans like you shouldn't be able to best me! If the two useless Brothers hadn't drained so much energy from me, you would be dead now!

name: Michinashi
dialog: But don't think you've won: even if I will be no more, the Brothers are already revived. You will all die here. Muahahahaha!

name: Michinashi
dialog: Too bad that I won't be here when the "Gaze of Gods" is assembled again... I envy the lucky one who manages to get their hands on it...

name: Mami
dialog: Hey, is it just me, or is the earth rumbling?
The ground started to shake violently.

name: Uriel
dialog: Senpai, look!
Countless Monsters poured out from the entrance of the Realm of Trials.
Two ominous and gigantic figures stood among the expanding swamp of Monsters created from negative emotions.

name: Ao Oni
dialog: We live again, Brother... And with our rebirth, we shall bring doom to everyone who dares to stand in our way.

name: Mami
dialog: Is there truly no more hope for us...?
Don't lose faith yet --- look!
A ray of light protruded from the veil of negative emotions enveloping the entrance to the Realm of Trials.
It came from a mirror, shining as bright as the rising sun, and dispersed the night with its radiance.
As its spectators marveled at its brilliance, the mirror flew into the Shrine and disappeared out of sight.

name: Ao Oni
dialog: That is... The artifact of that God! It will not fall into the hands of you hateful mortals this time!

name: Uriel
dialog: Was that the "Gaze of Gods"?

name: Mami
dialog: It is our only hope. I have to stay and fight with the Blazing Eagles. Can I trust you to bring it back to us, *?
Oh, you're not worried that a "greedy outsider" like me will just make off with it and leave now?

name: Mami
dialog: No, I'm not. You have proven yourself to be worthy of my trust.
The "Gaze of Gods" flew in this direction... Over there! It's still glowing!
Chizuko? I thought you left with the others. What are you doing here?
Monsters noticed them and huddled in their direction.
Look, it's dangerous here, and I'm on my way to retrieve the "Gaze of Gods". Can you get to safety by yourself?
There was no indication that Chizuko heard *'s words, nor did she react to the Monsters gradually closing up on her. She just walked slowly forward.
Something's wrong, but what? Michinashi is dead, and there are no signs of Chizuko being possessed by Chaos.
I can't leave her alone like this...
As * fought the Monsters, Chizuko kept walking towards the "Gaze of Gods".
The artifact slowly descended from the sky, and turned into a ray of light that entered Chizuko's small frame.
Is Chizuko... dancing? And the birds flanking her are... Cranes?

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: "...the moves were smooth and graceful as she twisted and twirled unscathed in the flames meant to harm her."

name: Shrine Maidens
dialog: "All of a sudden, the sounds of birds flapping their wings could be heard, and a flock of black, white, and red birds appeared on the horizon."
Is that the fabled Kagura Dance?!

title: The Awakening
dialog: Earlier that day---

name: Chizuko
dialog: This way, everyone!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Oh, please don't push the person in front of you, this wouldn't help you escape faster!

name: Chizuko
dialog: The Shrine is mostly vacated now... I think it's okay for me to leave too.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I'm worried about Mami and the others. I could have been fighting with them if I wasn't so frail and weak...

name: Chizuko
dialog: ... Wishful thinking like that wouldn't help them now. I should trust them; members of the Blazing Eagles are well-trained for situations like this.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I need to get to safety so they won't be worried about me.

name: Chizuko
dialog: It's fine...

name: Chizuko
dialog: Where...am I? Where am I heading to...?

name: Chizuko
dialog: I feel warm and floaty, like walking on clouds...

name: Chizuko
dialog: Who are you...?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Are you calling for me...?

name: Chizuko
dialog: I am... Chizuko.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I am...

name: Chizuko
dialog: Wh-What's going on?! And what am I wearing?
Welcome back, Chizuko, you really got us worried back there. How do you feel now?

name: Chizuko
dialog: *? What happened? Why am I here?
No idea. I tried to talk to you, but you didn't seem to have heard me and started to dance after you walked here.
Oh, and the "Gaze of Gods" seems to have fused with you somehow. Can you feel it?

name: Chizuko
dialog: Fused with me? So it's inside me?? But I don't feel anything!
A Monster charged at Chizuko, screaming shrilly.
Watch out!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Ahhhh! Go away!!
Chizuko thrust her arms forward to shield herself from the Monster, only for a beam of sunlight to shine out from her long sleeves and searing it to ashes.
That was awesome, Chizuko, I didn't know you could do that!

name: Chizuko
dialog: Wait, I did that?

name: Shrine Maiden
dialog: (Screams from far away) Kyouko! Stay with us, Kyouko!!

name: Aka Oni
dialog: Muahahahaha, all of you shall perish!!

name: Chizuko
dialog: It's Mami and the Blazing Eagles! They're in danger...

name: Chizuko
dialog: I was weak before, but with this power...

name: Chizuko
dialog: ... I can help!

name: Mami
dialog: Something is flying towards us. Those are... cranes!

name: Kyouko
dialog: This light... Our God is back with us...

name: Ao Oni
dialog: You are a lot shorter than I remembered you to be, Homura-Ōmikami.

name: Ao Oni
dialog: It's impossible! How are you still alive?!

name: Chizuko
dialog: (Get a grip on yourself, Chizuko. Do not be intimidated by these Monsters.)

name: Chizuko
dialog: (I have the power to protect everyone in the Shrine. I will not back down!)

name: Chizuko
dialog: No matter what you say, vile creatures, I will put a stop to your evil deeds today!

name: Mami
dialog: (Whispers) This voice... Chizuko? It's happening now...
Uh, yes, it's Chizuko. Are you alright, Mami? Are you hurt or injured anywhere?

name: Mami
dialog: Hmph, of course not. Who do you think I am?

name: Mami
dialog: (Whispers furiously) Don't tell anyone else about Chizuko!
Don't worry, I'm not planning on doing that. Wait, did you know that this will happen to her?

name: Mami
dialog: It's a long story. I'll explain later.

name: Ao Oni & Aka Oni
dialog: Homura-Ōmikami! We shall not fall to you once more. Face our hatred!

name: Chizuko
dialog: You may try, but know that you are doomed to fail. Be prepared to repent for your sins!

title: New Allies
dialog: Last night, when the light faded, both the Brothers and the Monsters disappeared.
Chizuko was unconscious, and Mami carried her all the way back.

name: Chizuko
dialog: I heard from the others that you helped us with fighting the Chaos creatures and the Monsters! I can't thank you enough for everything you have done for us, *!

name: Chizuko
dialog: I can't believe I slept through all of that and even missed witnessing Homura-Ōmikami in Their full glory...
Uh Chizuko, but wasn't it...

name: Mami
dialog: Ahem.
Mami cleared her throat and glared.
...Uh, yeah, I'm sorry that you missed it too.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Thankfully, Mami promised that she will tell me everything in detail.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Besides, if the only time Homura-Ōmikami will appear is when the Monsters are invading this world, I'd settle for never seeing Them.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: I apologize for interrupting you in the middle of a conversation, Chizuko, but we have important matters to discuss with our honored guests from Yume Academy.

name: Chizuko
dialog: Oh, you're going to talk about secrets! I'll get going then.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: I had a discussion with President KongMing yesterday, who explained your situation.
KongMing? Is she here?

name: Mami
dialog: Nope, you just dropped your communicator. I found it when I was sweeping.

name: Mami
dialog: She was attempting to contact you, so we talked to her. I'm sorry for the misunderstanding, by the way.
It's okay, we were acting quite suspicious in retrospect.
Is everything resolved yesterday? Are there any more threats or dangers lingering on the horizon?

name: Kugatsu
dialog: Everything is under control now. The Brother's ashes are sealed securely in the Realm of Trials, and the "Gaze of Gods" has been restored to its rightful place as well.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: As for what happened to Chizuko... I implore you to keep Chizuko's conditions in secrecy for now.
By the way, what actually happened to her? And why doesn't she remember anything today?

name: Kugatsu
dialog: Chizuko has the potential to be a vessel of Homura-Ōmikami's powers. She can draw upon Their strength through her prayers.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: We were worried that she would not be able to comprehend the implications of hosting such powers at a young age, so we kept it a well-hidden secret and treated her as we would any other Shrine Maiden.

name: Kugatsu
dialog: Her loss of memory can probably be ascribed to her being overwhelmed by the divine strength of Homura-Ōmikami. Personally, I feel like not having this memory is more a blessing than a curse for her.
I see... Don't worry, I won't blab.

name: Kugatsu
